Creator: https://jazz.ibm.com:9443/jts/users/ibm
Primary Text: The Stakeholder requirements describe the user needs for a water meter reading system (AMR) including the meter, the method of collecting data from the device, and the means by which the customers will be billed for usage.

Creator: https://jazz.ibm.com:9443/jts/users/ibm
Primary Text: The AMR is intended for gathering and reporting of water consumtion data to facilitate measurement of residential and business customers.

Creator: https://jazz.ibm.com:9443/jts/users/ibm

Primary Text: The systems shall meet the following objectives:

Creator: https://jazz.ibm.com:9443/jts/users/ibm
Primary Text: A trained user shall be able to use all aspects of the system within no more than one minutes of system startup.
Title: A trained user shall be able to use all aspects of the system within no more than one minutes of system startup.

Creator: https://jazz.ibm.com:9443/jts/users/ibm
Primary Text: The system software and functions shall be quickly and easily movable to another computer or workstation in the event of failure of the control computer.

Creator: https://jazz.ibm.com:9443/jts/users/ibm
Primary Text: The AMR system shall have an operational life of no less than five years.
Title: The AMR system shall have an operational life of no less than five years.

Creator: https://jazz.ibm.com:9443/jts/users/ibm
Primary Text: The AMR system shall be able to operate in the market environments for which it is targeted and approved.
Title: The AMR system shall be able to operate in the market environments for which it is targeted and approved.

Creator: https://jazz.ibm.com:9443/jts/users/ibm
Primary Text: In handheld AMR, a meter reader carries a handheld computer with the ability to collect meter readings from an AMR capable meter. This is sometimes referred to as "walk-by" meter reading since the meter reader walks by the locations where meters are installed as they go through their meter reading route. Handheld computers may also be used to manually enter readings without the use of AMR technology as an alternate but this will not support comprehensive data which can be accurately read using the meter reading electronically.
Title: In handheld AMR, a meter reader carries a handheld computer with the ability to collect meter readings from an AMR capable meter. This is sometimes referred to as "walk-by" meter reading since the meter reader walks by the locations where meters are instal

Creator: https://jazz.ibm.com:9443/jts/users/ibm
Primary Text: The AMR product is intended to allow water providers to lower their cost of operation by more accurately measureing consumption and more quickly gather data.
Title: The AMR product is intended to allow water providers to lower their cost of operation by more accurately measureing consumption and more quickly gather data.

Creator: https://jazz.ibm.com:9443/jts/users/ibm
Primary Text: Any portable equipment shall have an Ingress Protection Rating of IP66 or better in accordance with Standard IEC 60529.
Title: Any portable equipment shall have an Ingress Protection Rating of IP66 or better in accordance with Standard IEC 60529.

Creator: https://jazz.ibm.com:9443/jts/users/ibm
Primary Text: The handheld device shall allow for upload of all information collected on handheld computers during meter rounds, so that data can be compiled. Data shall be retrievable to business office computers in a manner that will interface with the existing billing system.
Title: The handheld device shall allow for upload of all information collected on handheld computers during meter rounds, so that data can be compiled. Data shall be retrievable to business office computers in a manner that will interface with the existing billin

Creator: https://jazz.ibm.com:9443/jts/users/ibm
Primary Text: Product Perspective
Title: Product Perspective

Creator: https://jazz.ibm.com:9443/jts/users/ibm
Primary Text: The desired solution leverages the existing infrastructure of meters, but may require enhancements to support a more flexible means of determining water consumption. The goal is to best provide services and read meters in an electronically automated and cost effective manner. It is expected that the system(s) will be made up of sufficient equipment such that if a failure of any major system component or part thereof does occur, it will not interrupt the flow of meter reading information to customer revenue systems.
Title: The desired solution leverages the existing infrastructure of meters, but may require enhancements to support a more flexible means of determining water consumption. The goal is to best provide services and read meters in an electronically automated and co
